item.title: “Are We There Yet?”
item.dc:creator: Yatharth Rai
item.description: “Halfway!”But before I begin, this is not a reference to that really bad, comedy movie starring Ice-Cube, but that nursery rhyme on ABCKids.The 2nd Evaluations are already here!The good news is, HelioPy will no longer be required any extra installation to handle CDF files! HelioPy will migrate to cd ...READ MORE...

item.title: Adding support for JHTD in PlasmaPy
item.dc:creator: Ritiek Malhotra
item.description: During this period, nothing big happened except we’re able to get merge a new Plasma subclass supposed to work with OpenPMD Datasets #500! It still isn’t very efficient to work with larger datasets and should rather be considered a prototype at the moment. It currently supports reading only mesh dat ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC - Phase two update.
item.dc:creator: Sushobhana Patra
item.description: GSoC - Phase two update.Phase 2 couldn’t have been more interesting. My last blog post concentrated on the first two weeks of this phase. To summarize, I worked on extracting a subcube using regions.Regions (and CRTF/DS9 region files, indirectly) from a spectral_cube.SpectralCube which is basically ...READ MORE...

item.title: Phase-2 Conclusion - GSoC'18
item.dc:creator: Prakhar Srivastava
item.description:
Ending the Phase 2

So today, on the onset of evaluation period of Phase 2. I would like to update all the reader about my work from the last post. It’s officially the end of Phase 2! We’re 2/3 of the journey of GSoC but it just began! Einstein’s theory of relativity thus seems to play its role: TIM ...READ MORE...

item.title: pH2
item.dc:creator: Vishnunarayan K. I.
item.description: It’s acidic.I’m kidding. [pH]ase 2 was neutral. Phase 2 was really smooth. It was so smooth that I accidentally missed a blog post (no one noticed, including me) and still don’t have a lot to write about.Phase 2 was mostly cleaning up and finishing off remaining work. The coding work for GSoC is alm ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC 2018: The marathon continues
item.dc:creator: Swapnil Sharma
item.description: It’s been a while since I wrote an article. Last two weeks were uneventful and there’s not much to share. The progress looks good and I am eager to submit my code for the second evaluation.I have written tutorials for the phase-resolved spectroscopy methods of Quasi-periodic oscillations proposed in ...READ MORE...

item.title: The 2nd Evaluations Approach!
item.dc:creator: Yatharth Rai
item.description: Can’t believe time flew so quickly!With the second evaluation period almost coming to an end, we have attached units to almost every single module in HelioPy! Conversion to units has essentially migrated the entire HelioPy from Pandas to TimeSeries, save for some modules, which will be converted bef ...READ MORE...

item.title: GSoC Diaries 3.01
item.dc:creator: Manan Agarwal
item.description: Hello World!It has been some time since I gave you any updates on Learn Astropy website, so here it is the Diary 3.01. Why 3 and not 2? Because the first coding phase of GSoC 18 has ended and in fact, we are already two weeks into the second phase. By the way, I have successfully passed the first ev ...READ MORE...

item.title: Solar drag and robust Kepler equation solution
item.dc:creator: Nikita Astrakhantsev
item.description: Hello everyone! During the last two weeks, I’ve been finishing primary perturbation goals and was studying the robust Kepler equation solution proposed in the paper “Robust resolution of Kepler’s equation in all eccentricity regimes”, Davide Farnocchia et al. The guy now works in NASA, actually :)So ...READ MORE...
